title: Quiz 3: Oct 2021 Theory FQE
topicName: Computer Application in Health Care Collection
description: October 2021 Final Qualifying Examination Theory Paper for Database Management (MS Access).

questions.question: A collection of interrelated records is called a?
questions.explanation: A database is an organized collection of structured information, or data, typically stored electronically.

questions.question: Microsoft Access is a ______
questions.explanation: It stands for Relational Database Management System.

questions.question: Which one of the following is not a top-level object of MS Access?
questions.explanation: A 'Row' is a component of a Table, not a distinct database object like a Form, Macro, or Report.
questions.hint: One is a part of a table, not a separate file object.

questions.question: Which option allows us to build a new table by entering data directly into a tabular grid?
questions.explanation: Datasheet view looks like a spreadsheet and allows direct data entry.
questions.hint: It looks like an Excel sheet.

questions.question: An External database source in Access can be:

options.text: Database created using another DBMS package

questions.explanation: Access can import or link data from various external sources including other DBMS, Excel, and text files.

questions.question: A primary key in any table has which properties?
questions.explanation: A Primary Key must be unique (No Duplicates) and cannot contain empty values (Not Null).
questions.hint: It must uniquely identify every record.

questions.question: Report generators are used to:

options.text: Store data input by a user
Both retrieve information and answer queries in printable format

questions.explanation: Reports are output objects used to display and print data extracted from tables or queries.

questions.question: The logical data structure capable of representing a one-to-many relationship is a:
questions.explanation: A Tree (Hierarchical) structure naturally represents a Parent (1) to Child (Many) relationship.
questions.hint: Think of branches growing from a trunk.

questions.question: In a database, related fields are grouped to form a:
questions.explanation: A record is a collection of related fields describing one entity.

questions.question: In one-to-many relationship the table in 'one' side is called ____ and on 'many' side is called ____.
questions.explanation: Parent (One) -> Child (Many).

questions.question: The database environment has all the following components EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: The purpose of a database environment is to integrate data, eliminating the 'separate files' approach of traditional file processing systems.
questions.hint: Databases are meant to bring data TOGETHER.

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT a data type?
questions.explanation: Field size is a *property* of a data type, not a data type itself.
questions.hint: It describes how large the data is.

questions.question: Which database handles full text data, image, audio and video?
questions.explanation: Multimedia databases are designed to store different media formats.

questions.question: What do you mean by a one-to-many relationship between a Teacher and Class table?

options.text: One class may have many teachers
One teacher can have many classes
Many classes may have many teachers
Many teachers may have many classes

questions.explanation: In this specific context (1:M), one teacher entity relates to multiple class entities.

questions.question: Define the term 'Input Mask':

options.text: It is a field property that controls the format of data entry
It is an association among several entities
It's a collection of related fields
It is a collection of related records

questions.explanation: Input masks restrict how data is entered (e.g., forcing a phone number format).

questions.question: In which stage does one gather and list all the necessary fields for the database design project?
questions.explanation: Defining what data (fields) you need is the first step in design.

questions.question: Which of the following enables us to view data from a table based on specific criteria?
questions.explanation: Queries allow filtering and retrieving specific data.
questions.hint: It asks a question of the data.

questions.question: Which data type allows alphanumeric characters and special symbols to be entered?
questions.explanation: Text fields hold letters, numbers, and symbols.

questions.question: The size of a Yes/No field in Access is always:
questions.explanation: It stores 0 or -1, requiring only 1 bit of storage.

questions.question: What is used to establish an association between related tables?
questions.explanation: A Relationship connects tables via keys.

questions.question: Which field type will you select if you need to enter long text (e.g. paragraphs) in that field?
questions.explanation: Memo (Long Text) stores up to 65,536 characters, whereas Short Text stores 255.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of MS Access database object?
questions.explanation: Worksheets are Excel components. Access uses Tables.

questions.question: In which method do we NOT need to specify the field type and size while creating a new Table?

options.text: Create Table by Entering Data (Datasheet View)

questions.explanation: Access detects data types automatically when you type data into a blank datasheet.

questions.question: The storage size of a standard number data type in Access generally CANNOT be:
questions.explanation: Standard number types are Byte(1), Integer(2), Long(4), Double(8). 16 bytes is specific to Replication ID (GUID) or Decimal, but in the context of standard numeric choices, 16 is the outlier for common types like Integer/Long.

questions.question: How can you edit a relationship already established between two tables?

options.text: Right click the relationship line and choose Edit Relationship

questions.explanation: Both actions open the Edit Relationships dialog.

questions.question: Which of the following option creates a Drop down List of values?
questions.explanation: Lookup Wizard helps create a Combo Box (drop down).

questions.question: What is the maximum length of a standard Text (Short Text) field?
questions.explanation: Short Text is limited to 255 characters.

questions.question: What is the 'Cascade Delete' option used for in relationships?

options.text: It deletes all records in the database
It deletes records in the current table only
It ensures related child records are deleted when the parent record is deleted

questions.explanation: Cascade Delete maintains referential integrity by removing orphan records automatically when the parent is deleted.

questions.question: While creating a relationship using the mouse, how does the mouse pointer look when dragging a field?
questions.explanation: Access indicates a drag-and-drop operation with a small rectangle icon.

questions.question: ____ enables the user to automatically insert sequential or random numbers.
questions.explanation: AutoNumber fields generate unique numbers for each record automatically.
